(45) 26.8th June, 1945.CABINET.GENERAL ELECTION-POLITICAL ACTIVITIES BY MEMBERS OEHIS MAJESTY'S FORCES.Minute by the Prime Minister and Minister of Defence.I have received the annexed Report from the Committee appointed by theCabinet on the 5th June.* I think the conclusion at No. 3 can be stated in asimpler form, viz. : " Members of His Majesty's Forces will be free to attendpolitical meetings in uniform or plain clothes. They cannot speak or sit on the platform or otherwise play an active part in political proceedings during theElection unless they wear plain clothes."w. s. c.10 downing Street, S.W.1,8th June, 1945.REPORT,THE following rules will apply in the United Kingdom only and willremain in force only between the date of the Dissolution of Parliament andPolling Day.t They will apply to all three Services and to members of ailParties.2. All bona fide candidates who are serving, or have served during thepresent war, in His Majesty's Forces, whether former Members of Parliament,or not, will be entitled to wear uniform while taking part in political activities,whether in their own constituencies or elsewhere.3. Members of His Majesty's Forces will be free to attend political meetings in uniform. This will carry with it the right to ask questions from the body ofthe hall, but not the right to speak or to sit on the platform. If members of HisMajesty's Forces wish to speak at a political meeting-, or othei'wise to play an active part in political proceedings during the Election, they must wearplain clothes.* CM. (45) 5th Conclusions, Minute 8.f i.c, in general, between 15th June and 5th July; but in constituencies where Polling day is postponed to 12th or 19th July the rules will continue to apply up to the date on which the poll is held.
